name: Sabraan

attributes.attribute: built on a site in Gloucestershire
believed to have been inhabited from pre-Celtic times
derived from or connected to a pre-Celtic goddess of the region

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A Romano-Celtic Temple found in Gloucestershire is dedicated to the worship of Sabraan, a British goddess. The temple is thought to have been established on an ancient site which stretches back to the pre-Celtic era, posing a possibility that Sabraan might have been previously linked with a goddess hailing from the same region. This goddess remains shrouded in obscurity with scant information available about her.
